events.title: Christopher Columbus Arrives at Hispaniola
events.description: Christopher Columbus landed on the island of Hispaniola during his second voyage to the Americas, marking one of the first European contacts with the native Ta√≠no people.
events.significance: This event was crucial in the European colonization of the Americas and the subsequent cultural exchanges and conflicts.

events.title: Gettysburg Address Delivered by Abraham Lincoln
events.description: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address at the dedication ceremony of the Soldiers' National Cemetery in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.
events.significance: This brief but powerful speech redefined the purpose of the Civil War and became a defining statement of American national identity and equality.

events.title: Mickey Mouse Makes First Appearance
events.description: Walt Disney's character Mickey Mouse made his first appearance in the cartoon short "Steamboat Willie," regarded as the first synchronized sound cartoon.
events.significance: Mickey Mouse became an iconic cultural symbol and the beginning of Disney's entertainment empire.

events.title: Jonestown Massacre
events.description: More than 900 members of the Peoples Temple cult died in a mass murder-suicide in Jonestown, Guyana, orchestrated by their leader Jim Jones.
events.significance: The event is remembered as one of the largest mass deaths in modern history and prompted increased awareness and concern regarding cults and extremist groups.
